column2: Kathleen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was having terrible headaches that also brought on ocular headaches.  It got so bad that I shut myself up in my apartment for days trying to overcome the sensitivity to light and sound.  My doctor gave me a sample of Cephadyn and  I no longer suffer.  If you take this at the first sign of a headache you are OK within 20 minutes.  This is a miracle drug for me.  I'm told by walgreens that this is being discontinued. I found this on the internet and it's not discontinued so if your told it is then go online and you'll find it!!!

column2: kenziesmommy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with an arachnod cyst and this medicine has helped my pain better than narcotics. I have tried all the migraine meds out there and this is the only thing that helps.

column2: StacieHedrick77, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication has worked wonders for my headaches and has not caused stomach irritation.  I suffer from stomach ulcers and this medication works very well in avoiding any irritation.  I do not feel as though this medication is habit forming.  I rarely take this medication unless I have a severe headache.  I only take it when absolutely necessary and do not feel the need to take it otherwise.

column2: Delta, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this to treat and prevent coital cephalgia. It works very well.

column2: Stormy7373, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering from terrible, debilitating migraines for many years. My Dr prescribed this to me on my last visit so I would have something to help with my headaches until I get in to see the Neurologist. So far it has helped tremendously. The only side effect I have is drowsiness, but I'm hoping that will go away after a while. I suggest taking this immediately upon getting a headache. Waiting makes it not as effective.

column2: elfnday, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from migraines for the past 10 years. I have been getting them more frequently the past 3 months. I normally take Excedrin migraine, but my Doctor gaveme a sample of these to take incase the Excedrin didn't work. I have had a headache the past 2 days and decided to take the sample, and my headache was gone within 15 minutes. I am going to call my Doctor tomorrow to ask for a prescription.

column2: caligirl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this medication has helped my headaches tremendously. I get awful muscle spasms which either contribute or are aresult of the tension, these help

column2: Saralynise2, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am pregnant with tension headaches and my doctor perscribed this because it is safer for baby than what I was taking for headaches. I love it! I was also having trouble sleeping, but it helped with that too. I also feel more relaxed during my day and my headaches are knocked out within 15 minutes of taking cephadyn 100mg.

column2: Madi, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had migraines since i was around 12 or 13. This medication was given to me by the 2nd nuerologist and the only thing i have noticed is that it makes me loopy and only makes the migraines bearable for a couple hours until it wears off. i'm not impressed.

column2: SuffersFromMigranes, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with migranes since I was 12. This is the FIRST medication I have been given that helps. My migrane will occasionally come back after the meds wear off but I am getting relief and it only comes back maybe 10% of the time. I am very pleased and satisfied with my results with this medication!

column2: TexasRiverRat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've found that I must take this medication with 800mg of ibuprofen to really get relief from my headaches.  I have another medication (metaxalone 800mg) that's sort of a pre-headache med.  It treats muscle tension in my neck & shoulders.  If I time things just right the cephadyn & metaxalone are effective.

kywildcat1954, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The first time I took this med, I was asleep for 18 hours straight. I have started taking it again, after numerous other meds failed to even put a dent in my headaches.  I am on daily treatment of my migraines so this is helps when Tylenol, Advil, Aspirin, Excerdin or anything else OCT doesn't work.  I've had no side effects since the initial sleeping for 18 hours incident.  My last dose (yesterday) didn't even make me drowsy and helped alot.  My prescription says do not take everyday on it.  So I take it only when absolutely necessary.

column9: I have been having headaches for over a week and this is what they gave me. It does not work for me and I am still having headaches and now, I have to have a CAT Scan and if that doesn't show anything, then I have to have a MRI.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a t-8 para. with quadriparesis.This was given to me for tension headaches.It works great IF you take it as directed and at the first sign of that headache. I DO NOT wait and think a hot towel will help. I do the pill then the hot towel and I am doing much better. I have been on this since mid Dec. The pharmacy at first did not fill it but 2 days later I went back to another pharmacy and they sent it through just fine. They said it depended on the code and how the insurance company got it.
